medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in usual state of health until the afternoon when he noted crampy abdominal pain following lunch. The pain was described as constant and diffuse in the epigastrium and was accompanied by nausea with episodes of non-bloody emesis over the subsequent hours. In the evening, the character of pain became sharper and localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), with subjective fever and chills noted at that time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Tonsillectomy (childhood), Right orchiectomy for benign mass. No other relevant past medical history specified.
